titleStmt.title: The Books of Shaykh Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī (d.1870)
An Extended Bibliographical Database, vol. 1: The Printed Books

respStmt.note: With the contribution of Sean Swanick, Rezk Nori

availability.p: This is an open access work licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0).

sourceDesc.p: Based on a probate inventory document, written by a government official after Muṣtafā Salāmah al-Najjārī's death, dated 24 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1286 / 27 March 1870, which is now part of the archival unit “Awrāq al-ifrāj ‘an tarikat al-Shaykh Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī,” Bayt-i Māl-i Miṣr 3002-012642, Dār al-Wathā’iq al-Qawmīyah (Egyptian National Archives).

projectDesc.p: The basis of this TEI file is an Excel file, based on a Google Sheet document by Adam Mestyan, Kathryn Schwartz with input Sean Swanick and Rezq Nori, automatically converted on 22 January 2021 using OxyGarage. After this transformation, Mestyan transformed the TEI XML file from list to BiblStruct schema on...

The basis of the data in the Google Sheet document is the list of titles in a probate inventory document, written by a government official after Muṣtafā Salāmah al-Najjārī's death, dated 24 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1286 / 27 March 1870, which is now part of the archival unit “Awrāq al-ifrāj ‘an tarikat al-Shaykh Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī,” Bayt-i Māl-i Miṣr 3002-012642, Dār al-Wathā’iq al-Qawmīyah (Egyptian National Archives).
The original transcription from the daftar in DWQ was made by Adam Mestyan in December 2016, double-checked by Rezq Nori in July 2020.

editorialDecl.p: This project uses the ALA-LC standards for Arabic transliteration.

head.title: The Books of Shaykh Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī (d.1870)
An Extended Bibliographical Database, vol. 1: The Printed Books

div.p: Data collection, TEI XML markup, and concept by Adam Mestyan and Kathryn Schwartz
With contributions from Sean Swanick, and Rezk Nori
With help fromJoseph Ben Prestel, Daniel Lowe, and Yahia Shawkat

div.head: Introduction
div.p: This website is based on the inventory of books belonging to Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī (d. 1286/1870), a nineteenth-century Egyptian intellectual. We have identified the titles, enriched with bibliographical data, and located available scans of the copies. Thus this list reconstructs the books as we imagine them. The bibliographical data is searchible. We used the Library of Congress Arabic transliteration standard. [Here is the Arabic version.] The data also contains prices of the books as they were recorded in the inventory, with comparative prices (see below). The list can be read as the online supplement to Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī, T (Cairo: Ifao, 2019), translated and introduced by Adam Mestyan.

Sheikh Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī was an Egyptian literary scholar, poet, editor of the government bulletin during 1283–1284/1866–1867, and editor of printed books. He was closely associated with the entourage of Said and Ismail Pashas, the Ottoman governors of Egypt. Sheikh Salāmah, as he was known, was also part of an important enterprise in the 1860s, the “Society for Education” (Jamʿīyat al-Maʿārif), and of an association of Muslim notables who bought a printing press for the Society. When he died on 11 Dhū al-Qaʿdah 1286/12 February 1870 there remained unfinished business behind him (he owned and he was owned) thus his family complained and the government confiscated his estate in order to make a proper legal process to settle the debts.

This website is based on the list of book titles found in the handwritten Arabic inheritance inventory of Sheikh Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī. The inventory was made by the government official of the Probate Administration of the Cairo Governorate (Bayt-i Māl-i Miṣr): it is now part of the archival unit "Awrāq al-ifrāj ʿan tarikat al-Shaykh Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī," dated 24 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1286 (27 March 1870), unnumbered pages 8-25, 3002-012642, Dār al-Wathāʾiq al-Qawmīyah (Egyptian National Archives).

The website is more than the list of his books. It is an attempt to reconstruct the material collection at the moment of death of the sheikh hence there are scanned copies of the titles of the same editions. Though behind the project there is scholarly work, the making of this website involved some imagination and play. I hope it will give pleasure to the users.

D / د = daftar / دفتر; the inventory of the heritage of Muṣṭafā Salāmah al-Najjārī, daftar dated 24 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1286 (27 March 1870), pages 8-25; cf. Mestyan, Magical History and Muslim Printing (forthcoming).
DWQ = Dār al-Wathāʾiq al-Qawmīya, The Egyptian National Archives.
C / ن = physical or digitized copy of a given title. / نسخة
ALA-LC = Library of Congress transliteration standard for Arabic.
Q = as in undated table, Qāʾima bi-ʿilm al-Kutub al-Maṭbūʿah fī Būlāq, in Box 2, ABC 50, Eli Smith Papers, Houghton Library, Harvard University.
K1 = Fihrist al-Kutub al-Mawjūdah bi-l-Kutubkhānah al-Khidīwīyah al-Miṣrīya al-Kubrā al-Kāʾinah bi-Sarāy Darb al-Jamāmiz al-ʿĀmirah bi-Miṣr al-Qāhirah (Cairo: Maṭbaʿat Wādī al-Nīl, 1289 [1872]).

K2 = Fihrist al-Kutub al-ʿArabīyah al-Maḥfūẓa bi-l-Kutubkhānah al-Khidīwīyah al-Kāʾinah bi-Sarāy Darb al-Jamāmiz bi-Miṣr al-Maḥrūsah al-Muʿizzīyah (Cairo: Maṭbaʿat al-Shaykh ʿUthmān ʿAbd al-Rāziq, 1311 [1893]).
B = Bayān mā Ṭubiʿa min al-Kutub al-Kathīra min mundhu Tasharrafat al-Maṭbaʿah bi-Dukhūlihā fī Ḥawzat al-Dāʾirah al-Munīrah ([Cairo? 1872?]
A useful Arabic Wiki for Arabic categories of the bibliographic record: https://tinyurl.com/45m24nq6

This is most likely from Tunis, 1863 (there are Sharhs published from Cairo pre-1870s but this seems to be the only thing that can be a matn). Harvard has it in the physical. https://hollis.harvard.edu/primo-explore/search?query=any,contains,kitab%20al-muwatta%27&tab=everything&search_scope=everything&sortby=rank&vid=HVD2&facet=searchcreationdate,include,1800%7C,%7C1870&lang=en_US&offset=0

- THIS MUST BE DOUBLE CHECKED BECAUSE THIS MUST BE Bulaq but says Rezq: (لم يكتب امام الكتاب هل هو ميري ام براني) NB: The Munbai edition is 1299 = 1882, so not correct. There is an 1862 edition from a private press in Cairo (on Gale) but it is in 2 vols. http://gdc.galegroup.com.ezp-prod1.hul.harvard.edu/gdc/artemis/MonographsDetailsPage/MonographsDetailsWindow?disableHighlighting=false&displayGroupName=DVI-Monographs&docIndex=&source=&prodId=EAPB&mode=view&limiter=&display-query=&contentModules=&action=e&sortBy=&windowstate=normal&currPage=&dviSelectedPage=1&scanId=&query=&search_within_results=&p=EAPB&catId=&u=camb55135&displayGroups=&documentId=GALE%7CPNVSOZ070453633&activityType=&failOverType=&commentary= http://gdc.galegroup.com.ezp-prod1.hul.harvard.edu/gdc/artemis/MonographsDetailsPage/MonographsDetailsWindow?disableHighlighting=false&displayGroupName=DVI-Monographs&docIndex=9&source=fullList&prodId=EAPB&mode=view&limiter=DA+118600101+-+118691231&display-query=OQE+تفسير+الجلالين&contentModules=&action=e&sortBy=&windowstate=normal&currPage=1&dviSelectedPage=&scanId=&query=OQE+تفسير+الجلالين&search_within_results=&p=EAPB&catId=&u=camb55135&displayGroups=&documentId=GALE%7CUGQVFU150721336&activityType=BasicSearch&failOverType=&commentary=
